risks.name: HyperShiftClusterVersionOperatorMetrics
risks.message: Hosted/HyperShift clusters in exposed releases will fail to scrape cluster-version operator metrics.

promql.promql:
group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or
0 * group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})

risks.name: NMStateServiceFailure
risks.message: The NMState service can fail on baremetal cluster nodes, causing node scaleups and re-deployment failures.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type!~"None|BareMetal"})
)

risks.name: ConsoleCrashOnMissingPlugin
risks.message: If a Console Operator configuration resource references a plugin name for which there is no corresponding ConsolePlugin resource, the Console may crashloop after the cluster is updated to an affected version.

risks.name: HyperShiftClusterVersionOperatorMetrics
risks.message: Hosted/HyperShift clusters in exposed releases will fail to scrape cluster-version operator metrics.

promql.promql:
group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or
0 * group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})

risks.name: IPsecLargeClusterConnectivity
risks.message: Large clusters with enabled IPsec might experience intermittent loss of pod-to-pod connectivity. This prevents some pods on certain nodes from reaching services on other nodes, resulting in connection timeouts.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (ipsec) (label_replace(max_over_time(ovnkube_controller_ipsec_enabled{_id=""}[1h]), "ipsec", "enabled", "", "") == 1)
  or on (_id)
  0 * group by (ipsec) (label_replace(max_over_time(ovnkube_controller_ipsec_enabled{_id=""}[1h]), "ipsec", "disabled", "", "") == 0)
) and on (_id) (
  group by (resource) (max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id="",resource="nodes"}[1h]) > 120)
)
or on (_id)
0 * group(max_over_time(apiserver_storage_objects{_id=""}[1h]))

risks.name: NVMeSymlinkRegeneration
risks.message: Clusters updating from 4.18.x may experience NVMe symlink regeneration issues when upgrading to this version.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (name) (csv_succeeded{_id="", name=~"local-storage-operator[.].*"})
  or on (_id)
  0 * group by (_id) (csv_count{_id=""})
) * on (_id) group_left (type)
(
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal"})
  or on (_id)
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

risks.name: CrunConflictsWithNVIDIA
risks.message: Some crun 1.23 releases conflict with the NVIDIA GPU Operator over eBPF, causing issues with GPU workloads.

promql.promql:
group by (name) (csv_succeeded{_id="", name=~"gpu-operator-certified[.].*"})
or on (_id)
0 * group(csv_count{_id=""})

promql.promql:
group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or
0 * group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})

risks.name: HyperShiftProxyScheme
risks.message: Hosted/HyperShift clusters where HostedCluster has a configured proxy needed for IDP or ingress canary probes may lose the ability to login.

promql.promql:
group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or
0 * group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})

risks.name: NMStateServiceFailure
risks.message: The NMState service can fail on baremetal cluster nodes, causing node scaleups and re-deployment failures.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type!~"None|BareMetal"})

risks.name: AROMissingInternalLBSAN
risks.message: ARO clusters on 4.19 experience issues creating new Machines due to missing the Internal LB SAN in the certificate provisioned by MCO. See https://issues.redhat.com/browse/OCPBUGS-59780

promql.promql:
group(cluster_operator_conditions{_id="",name="aro"})
or
0 * group(cluster_operator_conditions{_id=""})

risks.name: HCPMetallbCNOCannotDeployFRRK8S
risks.message:
On Hosted Control Plane (HCP/HyperShift) clusters with installed MetalLB operator, Cluster Network Operator fails to
deploy a critical component FRR-k8s when updated. MetalLB will stop working properly and stop advertising services,
making them potentially unreachable from outside the cluster.

promql.promql:
(
group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
or
0 * group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})
)
and on (_id) (
  group by (_id, name) (csv_succeeded{_id="", name=~"metallb-operator[.].*"})
)
or on (_id) (
  0 * label_replace(group by (_id) (csv_succeeded{_id=""}), "name", "metallb operator not installed", "name", ".*")
)

risks.name: HCPServiceHealthCheckDisruption
risks.message:
When Hosted Control Plane (HCP/HyperShift) clusters running on AWS update a node pool, the Services of type
LoadBalancer may experience temporary availability disruption because health checks are not set up properly to monitor
Node readiness state.

promql.promql:
(
  group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id="",invoker="hypershift"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, invoker) (cluster_installer{_id=""})
)
* on (_id) group_left (type) (
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

  0 * group by (type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id=""})
)

risks.name: NoCloudConfConfigMap
risks.message: Upgrade to 4.19 will complete due to an absent cloud-conf ConfigMap in AWS clusters born in 4.13 or earlier.

promql.promql:
bottomk by (_id) (1,
  0 * group by (_id, namespace, configmap) (kube_configmap_info{_id="",namespace="openshift-cloud-controller-manager",configmap="cloud-conf"})
  or
  group by (_id, namespace, configmap) (kube_configmap_info{_id="",namespace="openshift-cloud-controller-manager"})
)
* on (_id) group_left (type)
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type="AWS"})
  or
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type!="AWS"})
)

risks.name: OldBootImagesComposeFSvsGrubProbe
risks.message: Upgrade to 4.19 will fail due to a boot image incompatibility issue if a cluster was born in 4.2 or earlier.

promql.promql:
topk(1,
  label_replace(group by (version) (cluster_version{_id="",type="initial",version=~"4[.][0-9][.].*"}),"born_by_4_9", "yes, so possibly actually born in 4.2 or earlier", "", "")
  or
  label_replace(0 * group by (version) (cluster_version{_id="",type="initial",version!~"4[.][0-9][.].*"}),"born_by_4_9", "no, born in 4.10 or later", "", "")
)

risks.name: VSphereStorageMountIssues
risks.message: vSphere customers using vSAN file volumes can't mount vSphere shared volumes and NFS volumes which server do not set NFS4ERR_ATTRNOTSUPP

promql.promql:
group(cluster_infrastructure_provider{type=~"VSphere|None"})
or
0 * group(cluster_infrastructure_provider)

risks.name: RHELFailedRebootMissingService

  group by (label_node_openshift_io_os_id) (kube_node_labels{_id="",label_node_openshift_io_os_id="rhel"})
  or
  0 * group by (label_node_openshift_io_os_id) (kube_node_labels{_id=""})
)

or on ()

or on ()

risks.name: NetworkManagerOVNBridgeMapping
risks.message: On some clusters, the NetworkManager may delete ovs-ports on RHCOS updates, breaking Kubernetes access to those Nodes and wedging the update into the exposed release.

promql.promql:
topk by (_id) (1,
  group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type=~"None|BareMetal|OpenStack|VSphere"})
  or on (_id)
  0 * group by (_id, type) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type!~"None|BareMetal|OpenStack|VSphere"})
)
* on (_id) group_left (name)
(
  group by (_id, name) (csv_succeeded{_id="", name=~"kubevirt-hyperconverged-operator[.].*"})
  or on (_id)
  group by (_id, name) (kubernetes_nmstate_features_applied{_id="", name="ovn.bridge-mappings"} > 0)
  or on (_id)
  0 * label_replace(group by (_id) (csv_succeeded{_id=""} + on (_id) group_left () group by (_id) (kubernetes_nmstate_features_applied{_id=""})), "name", "not hyperconverged", "", "")
  or on (_id)
  0 * label_replace(group by (_id) (cluster_infrastructure_provider{_id="",type!~"None|BareMetal|OpenStack|VSphere"}), "name", "not sure about hyperconverged or ovn.bridge-mappings, but the whole platform is safe", "", "")
)
